alert.note: Alert for Ventura (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 16 at 4:17PM PDT until June 16 at 5:00PM PDT by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM PDT THIS AFTERNOON FOR NORTH CENTRAL VENTURA COUNTY... At 417 PM PDT, Doppler radar indicated the thunderstorm weakening with light to moderate showers likely to continue for the next 30 minutes. Between 0.8 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. The flash flood threat will likely diminish if no new thunderstorms develop in the area. Therefore this Flash Flood Warning may need to be expired early. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Western Lockwood Valley, Lockwood Valley Road, and Highway 33. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...1-2 INCHES IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
